result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan L. Goslawski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan L. Goslawski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan L. Goslawski was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan L. Goslawski

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
Restitution =  $232.56 + 10% surcharge = $255.81
COC office to pay out Restitution
Credit = 3 days (if revoked)

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2017 at 11:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Bryan L. Goslawski
Current: N5934 Eighth Dr, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 07-12-2017)
Prior: N3813 5th Dr., Oxford, WI 53952

Jury trial on July 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on April 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on May 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the matter is not yet resolved and requests a trial be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for JT.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for May 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Return date on February 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz filed an authorization with the court.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset on the return.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 1, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on December 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

with conditions:

*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Defendant Bryan L. Goslawski in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set.
 Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is on a probation hold; given that, the State has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with T.R. or his residence
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get a public defender.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return  Return date scheduled for December 22, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
